comment: The one that got me into whisky. Good with food.
Has a little of the brininess characteristic of the Islay malts, but with a sweet finish and a beautiful, striking Rose color.
Not as fruity as other people say. Not smokey. Just smooth. Comes in a cool bottle too.
I thought this was a pretty good value, and very drinkable.
Found a bottle at the Pendergast in Kansas City. Too salty for me such that it masks some of the elegance that likely exists. Lightly smoky/peaty and a bit oily.

Sweet honey and toffee, hints of banana and brine.  Honey sweetness  encased in a creamy palate  The brininess is pronounced with the addition of water. Tongue burn slowly works its way all over.  A spicy, bitter medium length finish of oak and slight drying tannins. [86/100] [Tasted 11/10/14 @ Tellers Chophouse]
Nice wine nosing. Great palate taste sweet fruity but very short finish
Smells like feet, tastes like yum.
Finished my last dram. Hard to hate anything that they put out as a brand
12/17 really nice. Mild nose. Smooth fruity/vanilla palate. Slight smoke on finish
For price to quality ratio - it is perfect. Regrettably did not score more bottles when it was widely available. The perfect 'Islay-lite' for me.
not sure this is the right bruichladdich. more peat, good for my level, not too much.  spice. heat. like, could definitely live with this.
Sweet, vanilla, faint raspberry, some spicyness and white pepper on the back of the tongue. Tastes quite young. Not a smooth dram, but interesting.

Less peated but still influenced by the sea salt from Islay.  Very smooth and easy to drink. Still a long way from Sherry cask whiskeys. 

My favorite Islay Scotch.
Young and spiky ginger, apple, Barley forward and black pepper. Much better with ice. Becomes sweeter and less spiky.
